experience: You and Adam both know JD Lasica, Ike Nassi, and 3 others
My buddy Oliver pulled his PumpkinCam site off floppy from nearly 20 years ago. Revisit the massive pumpkin impaled on Cornell's bell tower!

In February 2013, I founded the TidBITS Content Network, a content syndication service that provides professionally written, edited, and illustrated content to Apple consultants and resellers for them to republish. Initially piloted with members of ASMC, the TidBITS Content Network is now open to all Apple professionals. See https://tcn.tidbits.com/apple-pros/

I have written numerous technical books over the years, starting with the “Internet Starter Kit for Macintosh” (which sold over 600,000 copies in all editions, versions, and translations) and including other long-running titles such as “iPhoto for Mac OS X: Visual QuickStart Guide” and “The Wireless Networking Starter Kit.” I also wrote a number of books when I was running Take Control Books, including “Take Control of Buying a Mac,” and (with Josh Centers) “Take Control of Preview.” At this point, I create only packaged books in which I handle writing, editing, and layout.

TidBITS is a weekly electronic newsletter I've published since April of 1990, making it the second-oldest electronic publication on the Internet. TidBITS focuses on news, reviews, and analysis of interest to the Apple Internet community.

From October 2003 through April 2017, I was the co-founder and publisher of the Take Control series of electronic books, using an innovative model that removes the friction from the book publishing process while improving the end product for readers and improving the publishing process for authors. In May 2017, we sold Take Control Books to Joe Kissell's alt concepts inc.

My Peachpit titles include:Eudora for Windows & Macintosh: Visual QuickStart Guide (2 editions)The Wireless Networking Starter Kit (2 editions)iPhoto for Mac OS X: Visual QuickStart Guide (7 editions)
Co-editor of The Risley Review, High Noon Athletic Club, Phi Beta Kappa

As a College Scholar, I designed my own major in Hypertextual Fiction, gathering enough credits in Classics along the way for a double-major. The most important classes I took at Cornell were, in no particular order, Carl Sagan's "Seminar in Critical Thinking," Matt Neuburg's "Greek Composition," and Gail Fine's "Aristotle". All of them helped me better learn just what it means to think, and if I had taken no other classes in my four years at Cornell, they alone would have made it worthwhile. Graduated magna cum laude.

September 29, 2010, Jean worked with Adam but at different companies

If it were as much a pleasure working with everyone as it it is working with Adam and Tonya Engst, it wouldn't be called work anymore. My partners at Smile and I were very impressed with the process of collaborating on the publication of Take Control of PDFpen 5, a guide to the latest version of our PDF editing software. Adam is a detailed and thoughtful editor. The final book by author Michael E. Cohen is that rare beast: a technical book that is fun to read. We would not hesitate to work with Adam and his team again in the future.

The Pied Piper of the Macintosh community -- quite possibly the most knowledgeable person in the world when it comes to all things Mac and Apple. I cannot guess how many times he's been quoted in the pages of the User Group Network and InfoManager newsletter. His hugely successful "TidBITS" is the cornerstone of the Apple world and quite frankly, most Mac users would give up just about any form of media so long as they can still get TidBITS. His wit, wisdom and breadth of knowledge is simply unparalleled -- yet his kind manner and level hand endears him to all who have the pleasure of his acquaintance.

summary: Writer, editor, and publisher specializing in Internet publishing of newsletters and books. In particular, I've published the online news service TidBITS since 1990, founded (2003) and sold (2017) Take Control Books, and started the TidBITS Content Network in 2016.Specialties: Apple community, book and newsletter publishing, Apple technical issues
name: Adam Engst
title: I explain Apple and Internet technologies via TidBITS and the TidBITS Content Network.
